title: On A Lark
content: What I want to do in this post, just for fun (well, more than that), is use the rules of this game to show how hard it is to make a strong and clear case for a point that would still be tough to make if I could use all words. I think/hope we can learn from it.
creator: Tom Murphy
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Crazy Town: Episode 119. Getting Real about Resiliency with Emily Schoerning
content: Dr. Emily Schoerning and her nonprofit, American Resiliency, translate the latest and most urgent climate science into useful information for communities across the United States. Jason and Emily discuss the potential collapse of the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC), the merits of mitigation versus adaptation, and how to take meaningful action in your own community.
creator: Asher Miller
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Innovation in a Post-Growth Economy: Incentives Beyond the Profit Motive
content: What might happen to innovation when we shift our goals towards making societies happier and more equitable, within planetary boundaries?
creator: Josephine Ewoma
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Oxford Real Farming Conference 2026 – Deeper and wider ways of engaging with the land
content: Among other things, the Oxford Real Farming Conference shows that there’s more to the movement than mere conventionalisation. The movement is doubling down—it’s attempting to deepen its understanding of the world. And there’s no time like the present for that.
creator: Oliver Moore
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Reducing Plastic Waste: Three Ways to Replace Disposable with Reusable
content: Each of us individually can help reduce single-use plastic waste. For example, we can advocate for adoption of reusable services in the places we work and play and take advantage of services like To Go Green where available.
creator: Melissa Gaskill
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Peak Oil (Not!), Peak Dispatchability, and WEF Risks
content: This week’s Frankly is another edition of Nate’s Wide Boundary News series, where he invites listeners to view the constant churn of headlines through a wider-boundary lens. Today’s edition features reflections on a new peak in crude oil production, the growth of non-dispatchable electricity, and a report recently released by the World Economic Forum assessing global risks.
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The quiet breakdown of relational contact
content: We’re in a period where relational patterns are shaping how people cope and also how they relate to power. Naming these patterns matters because they are often carried privately, interpreted as personal failure rather than understood as responses to shared conditions.
creator: Charlotte Del Signore
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Consumption Pyramid
content: This week’s Frankly unpacks humans’ current identification with the label “consumer.” Consumption is something much deeper and more nuanced than shopping or spending. Nate highlights the ways that it shows up across our whole lives – from basic needs and stability to status and mental escape.
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Young Organizers Survival Corps
content: The stakes are only getting higher for those of us coming of age at a moment when this country is changing from something like a democracy to Donald Trump’s chilling autocratic version of America. Yet if we know anything from decades of antipoverty organizing, it’s that the unfettered imaginations, moral clarity, and capacity for decisive action of young Americans can always triumph over the misguided political liaisons of their elders.
creator: Liz Theoharis
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: A Million Miles of Transmission Lines?
content: Transmission lines are not benign structures. They have their own environmental impacts, both on-site and off, that are not trivial.
creator: Kollibri terre Sonnenblume
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Groundhog Day
content: I can only imagine how wonderfully restorative it would be if I could always get home before dark… and be asleep through all the long hours of darkness. Then, by Imbolg, I would truly be ready for spring!
creator: Eliza Daley
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Restoring Hydrological Cycles as a Foundation for Water Resilience
content: By rebuilding functional hydrological cycles, societies can enhance the effectiveness of existing infrastructure, reduce vulnerability to climatic extremes, and regenerate the ecological foundations upon which water security ultimately depends.
creator: El Habib Ben Amara
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Plastic Fantastic (documentary review)
content: This is a timely, informative, often unsettling documentary, one whose power comes from juxtaposition rather than argument. It refuses easy villains or fixes and challenges viewers to think less about individual consumption and more about systems of responsibility.
creator: Frank Kaminski
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Western Mythos – Our Monster’s Spawn: Part II – The Theological Architecture of Modernity
content: I’m not suggesting that nothing has changed, nor that religion has faded into the background. Religious themes remain highly pronounced today, especially in American culture. At the same time, these theological structures have been secularized in ways that now shape experience far beyond formal belief.
creator: Kevin R. Nelson
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.
